name: start-os
description: A graphical server OS optimized for self-hosting
readme_summary: StartOS is a Linux distribution designed for personal servers, simplifying the self-hosting of software services. It manages installation, configuration, backups, and health monitoring, with a focus on user-friendly operation and a marketplace for discoverable applications.
key_features: Discovery, installation, and network configuration of self-hosted services
Service configuration and dependency management
Data backup and health monitoring
Marketplace for discovering and installing services
Optimized for running a personal server
primary_use_case: Enabling users to easily set up and manage a personal server for self-hosting various software services, such as Bitcoin nodes, cloud storage, and more, with an emphasis on user control and privacy.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, anthropomorphic server rack acting as a central hub, with various digital 'services' (represented as small, distinct icons like a Bitcoin symbol, a cloud, a lock) being easily plugged into and managed by the server rack via glowing, digital cables. The server rack has a simple, clean UI interface on its front panel displaying the status of these services. In the background, a subtle, abstract representation of a home network or personal cloud is visible. The overall mood is one of simplicity, control, and empowerment, using a 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, clean color palette and subtle digital particle effects.

name: Mic-E-Mouse
description: Repository Containing Implementations and experiments related to the Mic-E-Mouse side-channel attack(s).
readme_summary: Mic-E-Mouse is a repository focused on side-channel audio attacks that leverage computer mice. It provides implementations and experimental data for reconstructing audio waveforms captured through the high-frequency signals emitted by specific computer mice.
key_features: Side-Channel Audio Attack Implementation
Waveform Reconstruction Experiments
Support for AudioMNIST and VCTK datasets
Includes trained models and signal processing methods
Provides utility scripts for data collection and browser audio testing
primary_use_case: Research and experimentation with side-channel audio attacks using computer mice.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized computer mouse with oversized, exaggerated ears, subtly emitting sound waves that are being captured by a miniature microphone integrated into its scroll wheel. The mouse is placed on a desk, with faint, glowing audio waveforms emanating from it and being visualized on a small, holographic screen nearby. The background is a dimly lit room, suggesting a covert operation. The overall mood is mysterious and technical, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The image should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on the mouse and the visualized sound, incorporating subtle digital particle effects to represent data transmission. The repository name 'Mic-E-Mouse' is subtly etched onto the mouse's surface.

name: PCLink
description: Cross-platform desktop app for secure remote PC control and management, featuring a lightweight built-in WebUI and API for local or remote access.
readme_summary: PCLink is a cross-platform desktop application that enables secure remote control and management of PCs. It offers a web-first interface accessible from any browser, along with a FastAPI backend and a lightweight system tray application.
key_features: Web-First Interface (Responsive, Dark-Themed, WebSocket)
Remote Control (File Browser, Process Manager, Terminal)
Media & Input Control (Playback, Keyboard/Mouse, Clipboard)
System Actions (Shutdown, Restart, Volume, Info)
Screen Capture
Security (Password Auth, HTTPS, API Keys, Secure Pairing)
QR Code Pairing
Lightweight System Tray
primary_use_case: Secure remote PC control and management from any web-enabled device.
cover_image_prompt: A modern, stylized hand holding a smartphone, which is projecting a holographic beam of light towards a desktop computer. This beam acts as a bridge, showing a miniature, interactive representation of the PC's desktop, file explorer, and terminal within the smartphone's screen. Subtle digital particles flow along the beam, representing secure data transfer. The background is a clean, abstract digital space with the PCLink logo subtly integrated into the environment. The overall mood is secure, efficient, and futuristic. 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant, contrasting colors and clear, glowing elements.

name: bedrock-agentcore-sdk-python
description: Python SDK for transforming any AI agent into a production-ready application. Framework-agnostic primitives for runtime, memory, authentication, and tools with AWS-managed infrastructure.
readme_summary: The Bedrock AgentCore SDK for Python allows developers to deploy their existing AI agents, built with any framework, onto AWS Bedrock AgentCore with zero infrastructure management. It provides an enterprise-grade platform with built-in authentication, memory, observability, and security for production-ready deployments.
key_features: Deploy local AI agents to Bedrock AgentCore with zero infrastructure
Framework-agnostic: Works with Strands, LangGraph, CrewAI, Autogen, and custom frameworks
Zero infrastructure management: No servers, containers, or scaling concerns
Enterprise-grade platform: Built-in auth, memory, observability, security
Production-ready deployment: Reliable, scalable, compliant hosting
Runtime services for secure and session-isolated compute
Memory services for persistent agent memory
primary_use_case: Deploying and operating AI agents securely and at scale on AWS Bedrock AgentCore, abstracting away infrastructure concerns.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan in a bustling workshop, effortlessly transforming raw, unrefined clay models (representing local AI agents) into sleek, polished, and interconnected robotic figures (representing production-ready agents on AWS). The workshop is filled with subtle digital interfaces and glowing data streams, hinting at the underlying technology. One side shows scattered clay figures, while the other displays perfectly formed robots standing on a platform labeled 'Bedrock AgentCore'. The overall mood is one of seamless creation and powerful deployment. The art style should be a vibrant 3D isometric illustration with clear visual storytelling and a focus on the transformation process.

name: onedump
readme_summary: Onedump is a Go-based database administration tool designed for effortless backup and restore operations across various databases and multiple storage destinations. It supports native MySQL dumping, integration with `mysqldump` and `pg_dump`, and offers features like binlog backup/restore, slow log parsing, and resumable file transfers.
key_features: Database backup from different sources to different destinations
MySQL dump with zero dependencies (built-in native dumper)
Supports dumpers with dependencies (`mysqldump` and `pg_dump`)
MySQL binlog backup to AWS S3
MySQL restore from binlogs
MySQL slow log parser
Resumable and concurrent SFTP file transfers
Loads configuration from S3 bucket
Slack notification
Maintained Docker image
primary_use_case: Streamlining database backup, restore, and administration tasks across diverse database systems and cloud/local storage solutions.
cover_image_prompt: A master librarian meticulously organizing and duplicating ancient, glowing tomes (representing databases) onto various shelves and secure vaults (representing S3, local storage, SFTP). The librarian uses a special, multi-faceted tool that effortlessly copies the essence of each tome. Subtle digital particles flow from the tomes to the tool and then to the destinations, with small, stylized UI elements showing backup progress and success notifications. The scene is set in a grand, organized library with warm, inviting lighting, rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style, emphasizing order and security.

name: MK_XRAYchecker
description: mass checker for vless links and other types
readme_summary: MK_XRAYchecker is a powerful, multithreaded Python utility designed for mass checking the availability and latency of V2Ray/Xray proxies. It supports various protocols and can parse proxy configurations from multiple sources, automatically sorting working proxies by ping and speed.
key_features: Supports VMess, VLESS, Trojan, Shadowsocks, Hysteria2 protocols
Parses proxies from text, Base64 strings, and subscription links
Multithreaded checking with up to 1337 threads
Batch mode for reduced CPU load and faster checking
Automatic sorting of working proxies by ping or speed
Integrated SpeedTest for speed evaluation
Flexible configuration with numerous parameters
CLI arguments and interactive menu modes
primary_use_case: Mass checking the operational status and performance of V2Ray/Xray proxy servers.
cover_image_prompt: A digital alchemist in a vibrant, futuristic laboratory, meticulously sorting through a cascade of glowing, colorful vials representing different proxy protocols (VMess, VLESS, etc.). Each vial is being tested with a beam of light, and those that pass the test glow brightly and are placed on a high-speed conveyor belt, while failed ones are discarded. Subtle UI elements showing connection status and ping times are visible on floating screens in the background. The repository name 'MK_XRAYchecker' is subtly etched onto a workbench. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, high-tech aesthetic and a dynamic color palette.
